processed_nodes.problem_description: The node appears under-specified for a document: it has an empty attribute set, no description, and only one connection, making its purpose unclear. The sole neighbor has the same label and type, suggesting a duplicate or self-referential structure that should be deduplicated or clarified. Quality metrics (confidence, importance, source) are present; temporal fields are not required for this Entity type.
processed_nodes.resolution_notes:
- Verify orphan status: run a full-degree check (both in/out, across all shards/partitions) to confirm zero edges.
- If confirmed orphan and no ingestion plan references it, delete the node to reduce noise.
- If it was intended as a placeholder, enrich before keeping: populate minimum required fields (name/title, subtype/class, description/summary, source/provenance, confidence, external_id(s), created_at/updated_at) and attach at least one meaningful relation.
- Run a duplicate scan using normalized keys (external IDs, hashes) and fuzzy match on prospective name/aliases; if a duplicate exists, merge into the surviving node and rewire edges, then deprecate/remove this node.
- Tighten schema/ingestion rules to prevent creation of nodes with zero attributes and zero degree (require at least name and source at creation, or auto-quarantine such nodes).
- Correct the classification if too generic: map from generic Entity to a more specific class per ontology, if known from source.
- Add quality metrics and audit fields once kept (source, confidence, provenance link, timestamps).
